Show HN: Taggy – Open-source package to auto-tag input/text
text:
Hello!

I'm building a typescript based frontend package to tag/categorize any form of textual input.

Straight to the demo -> https://open-taggy.github.io/demo/

Project focus:

- lightweight (frontend package without any backend server stuff)

- easy integration (currently npm/vanilla, frameworks to come)

- free and open source

It works on the basis of a pre-defined list of trigger words (glossary). With this approach there is no need for any external services or heavy backend/ML-things.

Ask HN: Minorities of HN, how to tell my children about your plight?
text:
I know it's important to talk to children about e.g. race very early in their lives to help them understand what is a really complicated subject, and not come up with their own simplified ideas and then stick to them.

But I intend this question more broadly. There are many minorities that have suffered very deeply historically -- and still are disadvantaged today, even in relatively tolerant cultures.

I'm extremely privileged in all possible senses so while I like to think I have a good understanding of things in general, I realise this is a case which I cannot ever personally relate to and I probably lack a lot of perspective.

I understand this is a difficult question, but I mean it in earnest. My oldest is turning 3 and I suspect soon enough this is a conversation I want to start having. How would you like me to talk to my children about this, from your perspective?

Ask HN: What happens when you dial a phone number?
text:
I've always been curious about phone routing, but the Wikipedia article on PSTN is rather light. [0]

Back in 2003, I was living in the Midwest. On an August morning, I had a friend visiting from New York, and I couldn't get through to their New York cell phone number. Calls were always busy. Later we suspected it was due to the giant Northeast blackout [1], but never had concrete proof.

So how does cellphone routing work? If you dial a New York cell phone number and the phone is in Los Angeles, does the call need to be routed to an exchange in New York? If a number has been ported from Verizon to Google Fi, does that number still go through a VZW exchange given its prefix? Or is there a DNS for phone numbers that gets updated periodically?

Thanks!

[0] - https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Routing_in_the_PSTN

[1] - https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Northeast_blackout_of_2003

Ask HN: If you enjoy parties, why?
text:
What do you get out of them? I could easily point out the negatives, not so much the positives: usually, they are loud and involve large groups of people, many of whom would not be very close friends. So you can't really have a proper conversation with anyone, have to keep things/activities fairly generic, and have to make sure you are pleasant and social with people you don't know well which is more work than pleasure. Nobody gets to do what they would actually prefer to be doing. People tend to go around with drinks taking photos of themselves and telling each other how much fun they are having, but it seems like they are more trying to convince themselves and their friends that they are having fun instead of actually having fun.

The only parties I have ever understood or enjoyed are ones focused on a specific activity. E.g. a LAN party playing some game a group enjoys would be fun. Or playing cards or a board game or even a sports game if you're into that. Otherwise, what do you actually do?

So - what makes parties enjoyable for you? What do you think people that don't enjoy parties might be missing / should try doing differently at parties so that they also derive great joy from them?

Ask HN: Are recreation.gov camping reservations botted?
text:
I recently found out about renting fire watchtowers through recereation.gov. They use a 6 month rolling reservation window, so on 1/20 reservations are released for 7/20. After diligently trying to get a reservation every morning at 8am MST when they're released, I've realized they are 100% booked before I can even load the page.

Is there anything I can do to identify or beat automated scripts? My only thought is that some web pages are broken, so perhaps I can call those locations since they won't be reserved.

Here is a list of links to all the reservations available: https://www.firelookout.org/lookout-rentals.html

Show HN: Phantom Dicom Anonymization
text:
Hello everyone! I'm a medical doctor working at the intersection of machine learning and medicine.

I made a WIP DICOM anonymization tool in Python for my ML workflow. Unlike other anonymization modules, Phantom is whitelist-based, so anything not specified in the configuration file gets automatically purged from the metadata.

Phantom also partially supports getting rid of burned annotations in dynamic imaging modalities such as echocardiograms by masking any static pixels.

Looking forward to your feedback and tips!

Ask HN: Do you still engineer your SQL databases?
text:
I have the the sense that the somewhat mathematical treatment of databases in relational form is decreasing in favor of the less structured NoSQL databases. I am not an expert in databases, but this feels like a hype that will be reversed some time in the near future.

What experience do you have in the topic?
